## Mehulkumar Shiroya  
**Ph.D. Researcher | Silicon Tracking Detectors | Heavy-Ion Physics**

I work on the **Silicon Tracking System (STS)** for the **Compressed Baryonic Matter (CBM)** experiment at FAIR (GSI Darmstadt).  
My research connects **silicon detector characterization**, **simulation geometry**, and **high-rate tracking performance** for heavy-ion collisions.

## About
:::

:::{.split-body}
:::{.about-grid}

:::{.about-text}
I work on the **Silicon Tracking System (STS)** for the **CBM** experiment at FAIR (GSI Darmstadt).  
My work focuses on silicon sensor inspection and detector performance in a high-rate environment.

- Silicon microstrip sensor **optical inspection** & defect mapping  
- Sensor characterization: implant break, open passivation, dust, pad damage  
- Image processing workflows to locate and classify surface defects  
- Detector R&D aligned with CBM high-rate environment

:::{.split-title}
## Research
:::

:::{.split-body}
### Detector & Simulation (CBM-STS)

- ROOT/TGeo **geometry development** for STS  
- Primitive solids vs **CAD/tessellated** geometry comparison *(runtime, secondaries, physics impact)*  
- Tracking performance: efficiency, acceptance, momentum resolution  
- Data-rate studies (4–12 AGeV/c) for FEB assignment  
- Hits/cluster studies, thresholds, dead-time dependence, **dE/dx**
